title: Oh my god .... Vicktorious Graves hurts me
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZqvW7ig1484

This, this is what we'll be getting for reaching Gold? I know the skin is free for those who've climbed to Gold+ but, holy christ Riot.
Not to sound like an ungrateful twat, but that is the _worst skin_ i've seen in a LONG time, it's actually really sad because I know you guys usually nail skins for the majority of the time.
**
YOU PLACED MORE EFFORT INTO AN APRIL FOOL'S SKIN THAN A VICTORIOUS SKIN, LIKE WHAT???**

https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-JhPF6X44RDc/WMxJSoGJMFI/AAAAAAAAgKM/PXDRONxwjdkU9B6gto3yaPS4naQQ8fj6QCLcB/s1600/kog.jpg

replies.body: Sivir is still the worst victorious skin though. Sadly I won't get the chromas for this cause I like the black and the white ones.
At least Sivir looks remarkably different than her base. Graves looks about the same but with a purple cape.

> [{quoted}](name=Forbidden Siren,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=JLny2Uf8,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-10-24T21:49:06.749+0000)
>
> At least Sivir looks remarkably different than her base. Graves looks about the same but with a purple cape.

True, inb4 riot fans "but muh unique tiger/wolf pauldron!"
It is pretty cool though
The particle effects are really nice looking too.
you forgot the plastic head on his shoulder man! make's the skin the best skin every put into league of legends obviously

The spell effects actually look great. 
I'd like to see the modeal tweaked a bit though.

I don't generally understand what's wrong with the model either.
I mean relatively. There are a lot of skins which are IMHO overpriced, their particles looking blunt or more like recolors, uninspired model etc., so I mean it more in terms of -> compared to any other skin, the model seems okayish.

So what exactly is bad about the model? I mean, is it the cloth-piece, the lion-thing, the armor, the head, the gun?

Also, not that it would excuse it If it's really of such bad quality, but If they did indeed put "less resources" into it it's because there are the different chromas for different queues.

EDIT: One interesting bit of feedback I found is that the gun and pauldron look too plastic. Maybe darker yellow closer to gold and more metalic shiny effect would help.

The cloth-piece for sure, that very bright purple doesn't really fit that skin, a red or dark-green (what the chroma did really well) looks more royal to me, and that's what these victorious skins are supposed to represent, right, royalty? 

Also I really, really, really don't like the fact that the very beautiful chroma's (which look way better then the base skin in my opinion) are locked behind getting Gold in all 3 of the ranked queue's (Flex, Solo/Duo, 3v3  -  getting the chroma of the queue it belongs to) in my opinion you should be able to choose what chroma you want, for example: there are 3 chromas, you get Gold+ in Solo/Duo you can choose one of the three, you get Gold+ in Solo/Duo and Flex you can choose 2 of the chromas, you get gold in all three, you get all of them.

But all of this is my opinion so don't bash me for it.

With kind regards,
Wooosh
{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

> that very bright purple doesn't really fit that skin

Well I believe purple is the symbolic colour of kings so that's probably what they went for. But I would indeed prefer the black one, too.

> Also I really, really, really don't like the fact that the very beautiful chroma's (which look way better then the base skin in my opinion) are locked behind getting Gold in all 3 of the ranked queue's (Flex, Solo/Duo, 3v3 - getting the chroma of the queue it belongs to) in my opinion you should be able to choose what chroma you want, for example: there are 3 chromas, you get Gold+ in Solo/Duo you can choose one of the three, you get Gold+ in Solo/Duo and Flex you can choose 2 of the chromas, you get gold in all three, you get all of them.

That isn't really a thing of skin quality, though. But I agree, while it is nice to see exactly what year in what queue player achieved Gold+, binding champs and colors to years/queues isn't something I like. They could make it so that If you reach Gold+ you get Victorious Token that you can redeem for any Victorious skin you don't yet have, per queue you get Royal Token you can redeem for Chroma for Victorious skin you own.
They've already commented that they're gonna change the purple to be the same hue as Victorious Sivir's purple.

The model itself is fine.

The textures just look bad, like the lowest settings bad.
Like someone turned the shadows off of something.

The plastic-y feel seems to be a big issue for a lot of people,
pesonaly, the Hair just doesn't tell me ''Graves'', y'know?

There's another issue. If the hair was more Graves-like that might be another complaint. There are people who feel like this looks too much like Classic Graves so it reminds some people Graves Chroma rather than skin on its own.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=JLny2Uf8,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-10-24T22:10:09.556+0000)
>
> I don't generally understand what's wrong with the model either.
> I mean relatively. There are a lot of skins which are IMHO overpriced, their particles looking blunt or more like recolors, uninspired model etc., so I mean it more in terms of -> compared to any other skin, the model seems okayish.
> 
> So what exactly is bad about the model? I mean, is it the cloth-piece, the lion-thing, the armor, the head, the gun?
> 
> Also, not that it would excuse it If it's really of such bad quality, but If they did indeed put "less resources" into it it's because there are the different chromas for different queues.
> 
> EDIT: One interesting bit of feedback I found is that the gun and pauldron look too plastic. Maybe darker yellow closer to gold and more metalic shiny effect would help.

I agree. I think the colors are way to vivd and bright and its making everything look cheap. If there was some depth (make this dude look like he's been on the battlefield! rub some dirt and ashe on him) and better contrast, it would look a lot better. Everything is like a solid color so it just looks flat and plastic-y

> rub some... ashe on him

I've never heard of this ship before. I'm not sure what to think about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=JLny2Uf8,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-10-24T22:10:09.556+0000)
>
> I don't generally understand what's wrong with the model either.
> I mean relatively. There are a lot of skins which are IMHO overpriced, their particles looking blunt or more like recolors, uninspired model etc., so I mean it more in terms of -> compared to any other skin, the model seems okayish.
> 
> So what exactly is bad about the model? I mean, is it the cloth-piece, the lion-thing, the armor, the head, the gun?
> 
> Also, not that it would excuse it If it's really of such bad quality, but If they did indeed put "less resources" into it it's because there are the different chromas for different queues.
> 
> EDIT: One interesting bit of feedback I found is that the gun and pauldron look too plastic. Maybe darker yellow closer to gold and more metalic shiny effect would help.

I'm cool with everything except for the nerf gun.
mmhm, I love how his abilities look like fireworks.
Particles look great. But the actual skin looks cheap, more fitting for Toy Solider Graves haha
All the effort went into the victorious ashe skin, which you either have to pay for, or play 24/7 to earn.
And even if you play 24/7, you still won't earn enough tokens to get it.
You mean Definitely Not {{champion:161}} , changes him to a whole different champion.

You mean Gerald?
He's a nice bloke. 
Bought me a coffee once.
He helped me when I had a flat tire once. Such a nice man.
So disappointed

What exactly is wrong with it?
Apart from the missing cigar, it looks allright to me.

...Is it really that hard to just say what is wrong with it? :|
In the hours I put into getting gold on 4 accounts on 2 ques, I could've earned enough minimum wage money from jobs to buy half of the skins on the store.

>getting gold on 4 accounts on 2 ques

Well, if it gave you pleasure doing it, who am I to argue.
Well, out of 6 seasons, I definitely picked the right season to get banned. That looks closer to his base skin than all of the others. Hopefully next season will be better.
I though it was a chroma at first

I love it.


Though it's a bit disappointing that the chromas feel a lot nicer.

Mother of all that is holy, the particle effects on his Q and autos are fucking _sexy_.

That's definitely an upper tier skin in my book.

> Not to sound like an ungrateful twat

Well, too bad....

I like how it has the lion on his shoulder, so it looks like recycled Jhin skin.

Riot discussion:

"Yeah...this skin ain't gonna work boys"

"...victorious skin then?"

"YEAHHHHH"

It's important to note that this is pre release, and that riot actually does tons of tweaking to skins when they come up on pbe and when they come up on live. If you go through skin spot lights channel and look at many different skins pre release vs full release you will see the differences in quality. Personally I think this skin looks pretty good though, and I don't doubt this will be a great looking skin by the time they are done with it.

It has some great particles tho, and the model itself isn't that bad. I personally feel like most people, his textures lack visual depth and he is overall too shiny. Maybe if they darkened the colors a little bit and added some shine to the metallic details of the skin it would be pretty much good to go. 
The only thing I absolutely CAN'T STAND is the hair. The skin is pretty clean in general, which I don't really like on Graves but also don't consider it such a big deal either. The hair, however, is awful IMO, and added to the bright palette of the skin it makes him look like a discount prince charming (is he smirking, too? if that's the case, then I feel like that should go along with the hair)

Does anybody know how does chromas and queues match up? I assume the purple one is solo/duo, as its the one showed by default. Also the blue one probably is the all-queue gold+. Can't really figure out the white and the black ones.
i'm surprised they didn't but a black and blue tarp for him along with that pearl one
So many people are salty about this skin lol. Wish I got a skin for free and complained about it.

But that's what everyone says every year about the Victorious skin.
Last year Victorious Maokai was the worst.
Next year's Victorious skin will also be "the worst".

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

However, i do agree that the skin feels cheap.
Riot just don't want to put enough effort into a skin that they're not gonna make money from.

I guess the 1350RP Blitz skin with the 1350RP chroma was more important.

http://www.auplod.com/u/dpoula9d885.png
I still can't believe Ardent Censer didn't get a Victorious Skin....

I like Victorious Graves and I hate most of the other Victorious skins (except Janna and Elise).
Different strokes for different people, I guess.
make that purple/pink darker
i like the skin /shrug
He looks like something from Heroes of the Storm in these colors, and that's not a good thing.

Challengers get fucking $200 jackets.

While challenger is much _much_ harder to reach than Gold, it's still should be a good 975 skin at the very list.

I swear, these Vic skins are getting worse and worse every year.
Next thing we know Victorious skins are just going to be the champion base skin recoloured gold.
it's not like only 200 people can get challenger out of the millions of players

This looks like a 750 skin with some particles that were scraped in on a 50 RP budget, so perhaps our first 800 skin?

It has particle effects...

but the model and it's look is inferior to something like Iron Inquisitor Kayle.
i hope you realize it says it's "Pre-Release" meaning they're always incomplete at this time and want feed back.{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
